abstract: Class-action lawsuit lead by plaintiff Sharif L Stinson alleges that New York City police officers have engaged in illegal pattern of issuing summonses in the absence of crime or without probable cause; records show that one-fifth of the 3.8 million summonses issued between 2007 and 2014 were thrown out on grounds of legal insufficiency.
lead_paragraph: The suit says that New York police officers, using a quota system, have been issuing summonses in the absence of probable cause for offenses never committed.

headline.main: Class-Action Lawsuit, Blaming Police Quotas, Takes On Criminal Summonses
headline.print_headline: Class-Action Lawsuit, Blaming Police Quotas, Takes On Criminal Summonses

snippet: The suit says that New York police officers, using a quota system, have been issuing summonses in the absence of probable cause for offenses never committed.
